thread.title: Aston Villa transfer news: Left-back Aly Cissokho wanted by Olympiakos as Steve Bruce plots clear-out
thread.title_full: Aston Villa transfer news: Left-back Aly Cissokho wanted by Olympiakos as Steve Bruce plots clear-out

author: rforrester
title: Aston Villa transfer news: Left-back Aly Cissokho wanted by Olympiakos as Steve Bruce plots clear-out
text:
Swing and a Ciss Aston Villa transfer news: Left-back Aly Cissokho wanted by Olympiakos as Steve Bruce plots clear-out 
Defender has lost his place in Steve Bruce's side as the manager plans to reshape his side By Richard Forrester Comments ASTON VILLA defender Aly Cissokho is a January transfer target for Olympiakos. 
The left-back has struggled to find a role in the side since Steve Bruce took charge of the Midlands side in October. Aly Cissokho looks to be on his way out of Villa Park 
The 29-year-old made 11 starts before losing his shirt to fellow countryman Jordan Amavi. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog. 
And it seems as though his time in England is coming to an end as the Greek champions plot a move. 
Cissokho signed for Liverpool on-loan from Valencia in August 2013 but made just 12 starts in a highly disappointing campaign. 
Bruce is plotting a clear-out of the squad he inherited from Roberto Di Matteo and has already made one signing in Manchester United’s Sam Johnstone. Cissokho hasn’t had the most success since moving to England related articles Why Real Madrid's Isco could hold the key to Dele Alli's Tottenham future Henri the Sick Nottingham Forest captain Henri Lansbury's potential move to Aston Villa on hold among owners rift Done Deal Manchester United goalkeeper Sam Johnstone joins Aston Villa on loan for remainder of season Thai-me for a change Leroy Lita the latest player to join the Asian football revolution... in the Thai League Reuters 3 Nottingham Forest captain Henri Lansbury is in the middle of a transfer tug-of-war 
A deal to join Aston Villa has been agreed by current owner Fawaz Al Hasawi, the player has already agreed personal terms to link up with Bruce. 
But the stumbling block now is the perspective new American owners led by John Jay Moores and Charles Noell, who have thrown a spanner in the works with advanced talks to sell Lansbury to local rivals Derby.
